intro: Struthanthus prancei, commonly known as the Prance's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. Struthanthus prancei is a perennial shrub that is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
